intro: Eupatorium collodes, commonly known as white boneset, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, white to pale purple flowers. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds, thriving in moist to wet soil conditions. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a rough texture with serrated edges. Eupatorium collodes is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally for its antiseptic and anti-inflammatory effects.
